intro: Eupatorium fruticosum, commonly known as sweet peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or moist environments such as swamps and marshes. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Eupatorium fruticosum plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in wetland restoration projects.
